title: Examples
text: render survey, pass JSON-compatible list surveyjs():
code: surveyjs(schema = list(   title = "JSON-based Example",   questions = list(     list(type = "text", name = "name", title = "Your name?")   ) ))

title: Examples
code: surveyjs(schema = list(   title = "Multi-Page Example",   pages = list(     list(name = "page1", elements = list(       list(type = "text", name = "first", title = "First name"),       list(type = "text", name = "last", title = "Last name")     )),     list(name = "page2", elements = list(       list(type = "rating", name = "satisfaction", title = "Satisfaction?")     ))   ) ))

title: Examples
code: surveyjs(schema = list(     title = "Question Types Example",     questions = list(       list(type = "text", name = "name", title = "Your name?"),       list(type = "rating", name = "satisfaction", title = "How was it?"),       list(         type = "dropdown",         name = "country",         title = "Select country",         choices = list("Germany", "France", "USA")       )     )   ))

title: Getting Started
text: render survey, pass JSON-compatible list surveyjs():
code: surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Feedback",     questions = list(       list(type = "rating", name = "satisfaction", title = "How satisfied are you?"),       list(type = "text", name = "comment", title = "Any comments?")     )   ) )

title: Getting Started
text: Use built-SurveyJS themes like "modern" "defaultV2":
code: surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Themed Survey",     questions = list(       list(type = "checkbox", name = "languages", title = "Which languages do you use?",            choices = c("R", "Python", "Julia"))     )   ),   theme = "modern" )

title: Getting Started
text: can override CSS variables using theme_vars:
code: surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Custom Theme",     questions = list(       list(type = "text", name = "name", title = "Your name")     )   ),   theme = "modern",   theme_vars = list("--sjs-primary-backcolor" = "#0072B2") )

title: Getting Started
text: Use locale switch languages (e.g., "de" German):
code: surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Ihre Meinung",     questions = list(       list(type = "rating", name = "zufriedenheit", title = "Wie zufrieden sind Sie?")     )   ),   locale = "de" )

title: Getting Started
text: Shiny apps, use live = TRUE receive updates continuously: Run shinyApp(ui, server).
code: ui <- fluidPage(   surveyjsOutput("mysurvey"),   verbatimTextOutput("out") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   output$mysurvey <- renderSurveyjs({     surveyjs(       schema = list(         title = "Live feedback",         questions = list(           list(type = "text", name = "comment", title = "Your comment")         )       ),       live = TRUE     )   })    output$out <- renderPrint({     input$mysurvey_data_live   }) }

title: Live Updates and Dynamic Control
text: vignette demonstrates : - Enable live response tracking - Dynamically update SurveyJS widget new data settings

what: Example: Minimal App with Live Updates
title: Live Updates and Dynamic Control
code: ui <- fluidPage(   surveyjsOutput("mysurvey"),   verbatimTextOutput("live_output"),   actionButton("lock", "Set Readonly"),   actionButton("reload", "Replace Survey") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    schema <- list(     title = "Feedback",     pages = list(list(       elements = list(         list(type = "text", name = "name", title = "What is your name?"),         list(type = "comment", name = "feedback", title = "Your feedback")       )     ))   )    output$mysurvey <- renderSurveyjs({     surveyjs(schema, live = TRUE)   })    output$live_output <- renderPrint({     input$mysurvey_data_live   })    observeEvent(input$lock, {     updateSurveyjs(session, "mysurvey", readOnly = TRUE)   })    observeEvent(input$reload, {     updateSurveyjs(session, "mysurvey", schema = list(       title = "New Survey",       pages = list(list(         elements = list(           list(type = "rating", name = "satisfaction", title = "Rate us")         )       ))     ))   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Live Updates and Dynamic Control
text: live = TRUE enables real-time tracking input$<id>_data_live Use updateSurveyjs() push updates server client

title: Live Updates and Dynamic Control

title: SurveyJS Htmlwidget and Shiny Bindings
text: Minimal bindings SurveyJS v2.x R/Shiny. rsurveyjs lets render interact fully customizable surveys, forms quizzes Shiny apps using SurveyJS v2.

title: SurveyJS Htmlwidget and Shiny Bindings
code: # Install from GitHub remotes::install_github("Tazinho/rsurveyjs")

title: SurveyJS Htmlwidget and Shiny Bindings
text: Integrates SurveyJS v2 R Supports Shiny input/output complete + live responses Customize via CSS variables using (theme_vars) Dynamically update widgets via updateSurveyjs() Supports readonly, initial values, multilingual forms

title: SurveyJS Htmlwidget and Shiny Bindings
code: library(rsurveyjs)  surveyjs(   schema = list(     title = "Feedback",     questions = list(       list(type = "rating", name = "s", title = "How satisfied are you?"),       list(type = "text", name = "c", title = "Any comments?")     )   ),   theme_vars = list("--sjs-primary-backcolor" = "#39f"),   locale = "en",   live = TRUE )

title: Shiny bindings for the SurveyJS widget â€” surveyjs-shiny
text: outputId Output variable read . width, height Size output container (CSS unit number). expr expression generates surveyjs widget. env environment evaluate expr. quoted expr quoted expression? (quote().)

what: SurveyJS widget for Shiny â€” surveyjs
title: SurveyJS widget for Shiny â€” surveyjs
text: Render SurveyJS form JSON schema.

title: SurveyJS widget for Shiny â€” surveyjs
code: surveyjs(   schema,   data = NULL,   readOnly = FALSE,   live = FALSE,   theme = NULL,   theme_vars = NULL,   locale = NULL,   width = NULL,   height = NULL,   elementId = NULL )

title: SurveyJS widget for Shiny â€” surveyjs
text: schema List JSON string; must follow SurveyJS JSON Schema. data Optional named list initial values. readOnly Logical; render read-mode. live Logical; send live updates typing? Default FALSE. theme Currently unused: SurveyJS v2 longer supports named builtâ€‘themes. theme_vars Optional named list CSS variables (e.g. --sjs-primary-backcolor). locale Optional language code (e.g. "en", "de"). See SurveyJS localization docs. width, height Optional CSS size number. elementId Optional element id container.

title: SurveyJS widget for Shiny â€” surveyjs
text: Shiny widget (htmlwidget).

title: SurveyJS widget for Shiny â€” surveyjs
text: widget renders fully customizable survey using SurveyJS v2 inside Shiny app. supports themes, read-mode, initial values, localization, real-time updates. Final answers delivered input[[paste0(id, "_data")]] user clicks Complete. live = TRUE, updates delivered input[[paste0(id, "_data_live")]] input.

what: Dynamically update a surveyjs() widget from the server side â€” updateSurveyjs
title: Dynamically update a surveyjs() widget from the server side â€” updateSurveyjs
text: function sends message existing SurveyJS widget rendered UI, allowing update data, read-mode, theme, locale, schema dynamically server using Shiny.

title: Dynamically update a surveyjs() widget from the server side â€” updateSurveyjs
code: updateSurveyjs(   session,   id,   data = NULL,   readOnly = NULL,   schema = NULL,   theme = NULL,   locale = NULL )

title: Dynamically update a surveyjs() widget from the server side â€” updateSurveyjs
text: session Shiny session object. id Output ID used surveyjsOutput(). data Optional named list answers set. readOnly Optional logical; toggle read-mode. schema Optional new schema (list JSON string). theme Optional theme name (e.g. "modern"). locale Optional locale code (e.g. "en", "de").

title: Dynamically update a surveyjs() widget from the server side â€” updateSurveyjs
